Greenhorse

APEX/WriteOn | associated_acts = Pat Green
Roger Creager
Randy Rogers Band

Stoney Larue | website = {{URL|corymorrow.com}} }} '''Cory Morrow''' (born May 1, 1972, in [[Houston]], Texas) is a [[Texas Country]] singer-songwriter who has gained popularity throughout the Southwest.{{Cite web|last=|first=|date=July 6, 2020|title=Texas country singer Cory Morrow connects with fans on Facebook|url=https://www.fox4news.com/video/736709|url-status=live|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200806190132/https://www.fox4news.com/video/736709 |archive-date=August 6, 2020 |access-date=2020-07-29|website=FOX 4 News Dallas-Fort Worth|language=en-US}} == Biography == Morrow was born May 1, 1972, in [[Houston]], [[Texas]]. He started playing guitar at [[Memorial High School (Hedwig Village, Texas)|Memorial High School]] in Houston and continued to develop as a musician while attending [[Texas Tech University]], where he was a member of the [[Phi Gamma Delta]] fraternity.{{Citation needed|date=July 2020}} In 1993, Morrow moved to [[Austin, Texas]], to pursue music as a career. He is also considered part of the [[Red Dirt (music)|Red Dirt]] music scene, that differentiates itself from the popular Nashville music scene. Morrow has sold over 200,000 albums independently. Morrow's 2002 release Outside the Lines reached No. 28 on [[Billboard Magazine|Billboard]]'s Country Album chart, No. 3 on the magazine's Internet Sales chart, No. 8 on its Independent Album chart and No. 16 on Heatseekers chart. [[SoundScan]] ranked him No. 7 among "country debut artists" that year.[http://lonestarmusic.com/biography.asp?id=23 Lone Star Music Artist Biography] ==Discography== ===Albums=== {| class="wikitable" |- !
